abstract: Indonesian government issues statement that it will not allow military to affect political resurgence and compromise civilian rule; statement follows Human Rights Watch report finding that military, national police and government are still undermining orders from Pres Joko Widodo.
lead_paragraph: The assertion by Luhut B. Pandjaitan came as Human Rights Watch released a report saying that elements of the military continued to undermine orders from Indonesia’s president.

headline.main: Indonesia Won’t Slide Back Into Military Rule, Security Minister Says
headline.print_headline: Indonesian Security Minister Tries to Soothe Rising Fears About Military Rule

snippet: The assertion by Luhut B. Pandjaitan came as Human Rights Watch released a report saying that elements of the military continued to undermine orders from Indonesia’s president.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
